column1: Ringsted is a city located centrally in the Danish island of Zealand. It is the seat of a municipality of the same name.
Ringsted is approximately 60 km from Copenhagen. Ringsted Station is the last station before trains bound for Funen and Jutland diverge from trains bound for Lolland-Falster and Puttgarden/Hamburg.
== Tourism and transport ==
Ringsted is one of Denmark's busiest transit cities. The city is located in the very middle of Zealand
column2: connecting both the southern parts of Zealand as well as Funen and Jutland with the Copenhagen area.

column1: Danish Tramway Museum of Skjoldenæsholm
Ringsted Station
column2: served by both DSB domestic trains and international (EuroCity) services to Hamburg: frequent services to Copenhagen
column4: although not all trains to Jutland stop at Ringsted — the bus station is in front of the railway station.

column1: St. Bendt's Church — a Romanesque
column3: abbey church containing numerous tombs of medieval Danish royalty.

column1: == History ==
Ringsted was the site of Sjællands Landsting (lit. Zealand's county thing) during the Middle Ages
column2: which in 1584 moved to St. Bendt's church and became known as Sjællandsfar Landsting. In 1805 it moved to Copenhagen and was renamed Østre Landsret
column3: and is still active under this name.In 1131
column4: Canute Lavard was killed in Haraldsted forest
column5: leading to outbreaks of civil war.

column1: The church was consecrated in 1170. In front of the church is the spacious town square leading to the shopping streets with shops and boutiques for every taste.

The town arms goes back to 1421. There has been much discussion about what it portrays. The traditional answer is at the top the hand of God and under that Virgin Mary with Jesus surrounded by three figures that worship her. The city officially interprets the three figures as Saint Canute Lavard
== Tourism ==
Ringsted features two shopping centers named RingStedet and Ringsted Outlet Center. Ringsted also has a wide selection of cafes and restaurants
column2: as well as two local breweries (Dagmarbryggeriet in Ringsted town and Det lille Bryggeri in Bringstrup) .

column1: During the summer months
column2: a mobile tourist office is opened in the town square.

column1: Ringsted was previously home to Santa World
column2: a tourist attraction featuring hundreds of animatronic Christmas elves

column1: == Notable people ==
Jørgen Roed (1808–1888) a portrait and genre painter of the Golden Age of Danish Painting
P. C. Skovgaard (1817–1875) a Danish national romantic landscape painter
Frederik Vermehren (1823–1910) a genre and portrait painter in the realist style
Sophus Schandorph (1836–1901) a poet and novelist
Edith von Bonsdorff (1890–1968) a Danish-Finnish ballet dancer and choreographer
Jette Baagøe (born 1946) the director of the Danish Museum of Hunting and Forestry
Poul Ruders (born 1949) a Danish organist and composer
Werner Knudsen (born 1953) a computer scientist
Michael Poulsen (born 1975) Danish vocalist and guitarist.
=== Sport ===
Fritz Tarp (1899–1958) a Danish football player
column2: with 250 caps with B.93 and 44 caps for Denmark

column1: Omar Hermansen (1913–1998) a Danish boxer who competed in the 1936 Summer Olympics
Helle Sørensen (born 1963) a former cyclist
Trine Hansen (born 1973) a retired female rower
column2: team bronze medallist at the 1996 Summer Olympics

column1: Ulrich Vinzents (born 1976) a Danish retired footballer
Henrik Hansen (born 1977) a Danish cricketer
Anders Oechsler (born 1979) a retired Danish handball player
Kristian Pedersen (born 1994) a Danish footballer who plays for Birmingham City F.C.
